tweets.html:
The only issue I have with the female Thor is that it seems a disservice to all the people who believed in Norse mythology in the past

— Brian Smith (@brianthecoder) April 2, 2015

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
I suppose last night’s The Americans was good if you like "wonderfully made television.”

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) April 2, 2015

when tom hanks and i get married we're really gonna have to do something about his son

— Brokey the Christmas Heaux (@brokeymcpoverty) April 2, 2015

Last night's L&O:SVU episode is titled "Devastating Story," just in case anyone was worried they'd started phoning it in for season 16.

— Kathryn VanArendonk (@kvanaren) April 2, 2015

If only we had a way to recycle Mad Men articles into water for California.

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) April 2, 2015

@crsbecker Yes! Those and "Official Oral History of X Cult Show" articles would sustain earth after the sun flames out.

— Nick Marx (@marxnick) April 2, 2015

Just typed in the cast credits for new season of "Game of Thrones" and my wrists are killing me.

— Brian Lowry (@blowryontv) April 2, 2015

Netflix counters their Bob & David news with the FULLER HOUSE announcement, covering all their bases, I get it.

— Brian Lynch (@BrianLynch) April 2, 2015

The new Golden Age of television, featuring nineteen singing competitions and reboots of Coach and Full House.

— Joe R (@Randazzoj) April 2, 2015

We are THIS CLOSE to Hulu announcing URKEL MATTERS.

— Brian Lynch (@BrianLynch) April 2, 2015

Who do I have to call for an 8-episode Silk Stalkings limited series?

— Justin Ellis (@JustinNXT) April 2, 2015

Between Full House, Mr. Show, Inspector Gadget and The X Files, the future of TV looks a lot like 1995.

— Alex Weprin (@alexweprin) April 2, 2015

I am available for rebooting The Cosby Show (only if we can get Cosby and license the old scripts). Lookin at the stoner hour. IFC? Sundance

— Julie Bush (@julie_bush) April 2, 2015

Breaking: Netflix Revives Entire TGIF Lineup, Yes, Even Meego.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) April 2, 2015

Netflix meeting: "Which show did Reed say to reboot? Something with an "F" -- Firefly.... No, Full House, I think."

— M.G. Siegler (@mgsiegler) April 2, 2015

Just filed a piece about how Netflix's original programming is spearheading a renaissance in quality TV. So what's the haps, everybody?

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) April 2, 2015

@corybarker This is the moment we’ll all look back on as the beginning of the end.

— Nick Campbell (@sononick) April 2, 2015

Maybe Netflix just wants to revive all the shows Kimmy Schmidt missed while she was in the bunker.

— Alex Weprin (@alexweprin) April 2, 2015

Seriously, though, bring back Square One.

— Margaret Lyons (@margeincharge) April 2, 2015

If you don't title your anti-"anti-Fuller House on social media" roundup "HOW RUDE," like, don't even talk to me.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 2, 2015

"too much ethnic casting so we're going to bring back Coach and Full House. that'll teach 'em!"

— Nichole ✨✨✨ (@tnwhiskeywoman) April 2, 2015

I look forward to the 13-episode Netflix series about Bryant Gumbel and Katie Couric sitting in a BMW electric car sassing each other.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 2, 2015

Netflix is rebooting FULL HOUSE? Isn't that BLOODLINE?

— Norm Wilner (@normwilner) April 2, 2015

Smaller Wonder
Silverer Spoons
Who's the Bossier
Squarer Pegs
Punkier Brewster
Websterer

— Kris Vire (@krisvire) April 2, 2015

How Mad Men will end: in 15 years, on Netflix.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) April 2, 2015

A world where EVERY show returns is the nightmare distopia Todd VanDerWerff warned us about!

We didn't listen, y'all. We didn't listen.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) April 2, 2015

Returning on Netflix: your innocence, your late grandma's cookies, the memory of lying on your living room floor watching dust in a sunbeam

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) April 2, 2015

TV: TWIN PEAKS back
US: Yay
TV: X-FILES
US: Yay
TV: MR. SHOW
US: Yay
TV: COACH
US: Um
TV: FULL HOUSE
US: Uh
TV: JUST TELL ME HOW TO LOVE YOU

— Glen Weldon (@ghweldon) April 2, 2015

Somewhere, there's an encyclopedia of television shows with the corners turned down on all the pages where at least half the cast is alive.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 2, 2015

The TV series reboot merger I'm really hoping for: HANNIBURKEL.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) April 2, 2015

@MarkHarrisNYC: "........Did I eat that?"

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) April 2, 2015

Wait, Netflix is reviving #FullHouse? Have they not read any of Bob Saget's jokes?

— B Haynes (@barbhaynes) April 2, 2015

bring back The Golden Girls it's just Betty White talking to a bunch of ghosts telling her to join them and how peaceful drowning is

— Omar (@1Lcampesino) April 2, 2015

The only way I will watch the Full House reunion on Netflix is if Bob Saget basically plays himself, detailing how Danny became so twisted

— Andrew Zolides (@DZolides) April 2, 2015

Most of the original "Full House" cast has signed on for #FullerHouse while the role of Michelle will be played by a rake with sunglasses.

— Ben Siemon (@BenjaminJS) April 2, 2015

Coach and Full House are now officially rebooted. How far away are we, really, from Family Matters winning an Oscar?

— Steven Zeitchik (@ZeitchikWaPo) April 2, 2015

*Reads the FULLER HOUSE news brief again*
*Puts on TOO MANY COOKS*
*Feels slightly better*

— K.M. McFarland (@km_mcfarland) April 2, 2015

The Americans posits that the USSR lost the Cold War by spending all their money on wigs

— Muffin MacGuffin🕯 (@MuffMacGuff) April 2, 2015

Netflix is using a demon's claw to resurrect Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz for 13 new episodes of "I Love Lucy!"

— Ben Siemon (@BenjaminJS) April 2, 2015

Hey Netflix, after Full House can you do a Growing Pains reunion where they try to convert Kirk Cameron to Scientology with a banana?

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) April 3, 2015

That grandparent that heard you say bowling was cool once when you were 5 & bought you bowling presents for next 30 yrs? That's Hollywood.

— Chad Hartigan (@chadhartigan) April 3, 2015

Remember when Pete Campbell's mother got murdered on boat???

— Sophie 🌹 (@insopherable) April 3, 2015

When I die please project onto my gravestone a never-ending gif of Pete and Trudy Campbell doing the Charleston.

— Katie Coyle (@krcoyle) April 3, 2015

PEGGY saying "I am so high" on a loop forever #MadMen

— ultralight meme (@GDS3000) April 3, 2015

Maybe Will Ferrell & Kristen Wiig made it up so that it WOULD be made after outrage that it would not? #ADeadlyAdoption ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 3, 2015

Maybe they were shooting in Indiana & couldn't get pizza delivered because babies should only be made missionary style? #ADeadlyAdoption

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 3, 2015

Actually it is Kerry's fault. Part of the #IranDeal was that Lifetime (America) would not make #ADeadlyAdoption

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 3, 2015

Lifetime has greenlit TV movie "A Deadly Adoption: The True Story of a Hollywood PR Disaster" #ADeadlyAdoption

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 3, 2015

Everybody involved thought the news wouldn't leak because they were using Ello. #ADeadlyAdoption

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 3, 2015

Whichever intern underling that came up with this #ADeadlyAdoption stunt in first place deserves to actually get paid.

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 3, 2015

This week's #Undateable is also really rare #GroundFloor fanfic.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 3, 2015

If you have a show and you need a cameo always use an NBA player, there has never been a bad NBA player cameo

— BUM CHILLUPS (@edsbs) April 3, 2015

I will NOT be the guy who points out shot continuity problems in #LipSyncBattle. I will NOT be the guy who points out shot continuity proble

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) April 3, 2015

there are only two characters on TV that matter and they are both named PEGGY #GoldenAgeOfPeggy #MadMen #AgentCarter

— ultralight meme (@GDS3000) April 3, 2015

Everybody black getting work this year it's lit. I just seen Tempest Bledsoe on my TV.

— Craig Bro Dude (@CraigSJ) April 3, 2015

See. This is what happens when you go weeks without Liv love. Go commando #Jake #Scabdal

— The NYC Film Chick 🧝🏾‍♀️ (@TheNYCFilmChick) April 3, 2015

"You have to go." Please tell him, Olivia. I'm still trying to figure out why he's even here. #Scandal

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) April 3, 2015

I don't know if we know how to act when Olivia's dating a Black dude (in canon and not just in flashback). #ScandalABC

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) April 3, 2015

"At the pharmacy on a tampon run" is now going to be a code word between friends who are up to no good. Thanks, Scandal.

— Natalie Tindall (@dr_tindall) April 3, 2015

Mellie's half-sister is an upper-case G. She makes soap out of tallow. Props to her. Mad props for using animal fats and ash in your soaps.

— Natalie Tindall (@dr_tindall) April 3, 2015

I just realized I stopped saying, "Shut up, Quinn" really early this season. She aiight. I guess. #ScandaIABC

— stacia l. brown (@slb79) April 3, 2015

"Just go, let me enjoy my hooch." Words spoken by many a #Scandal viewer to the people they live with at 8:59 PM. #Scandal

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) April 3, 2015

We Southerners are simple people. Give us a drank, fry something, and then let's talk about our stories and we're good as gold. #Scandal

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) April 3, 2015

Do we say "Hu-see" or "Huh-zee"? Asking for a friend. #ScandalABC

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) April 3, 2015

Jake tired of being an underappreciated, overworked side piece. Olivia can get these bullets.

— Nymeria of Rhoynar (@JSoAbove) April 3, 2015

What the Gladiators don't realize is that Jake has at last revealed his inner Noel: ice-cold, jovial, able to kill with a single font.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) April 3, 2015

Where is the funeral committee for David Rosen? When do we meet? What are y'all bringing to the repass? #Scandal

— NNN (@NerdgasmNoire) April 3, 2015

David, if you have that much of a death wish, just say on Twitter you like pumpkin pie more than sweet potato pie. It's easier. #Scandal

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) April 3, 2015

tweets.author_name: Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There
tweets.html:
"Leave me alone and let me drink my hooch."
I <3 Mellie.

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) April 3, 2015

AWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW HELLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLL NAWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW #Scandal

— Doctor (nay)Who (@jteeDC) April 3, 2015

YOU ARE NOT "THE GOOD GUYS," NOEL. I don't care how many satisfying twists happen in Scandal, you didn't believe in time travel.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) April 3, 2015

When the network starts referring to something called "Olitz" we have a bigger problem than we originally thought. #ScandalABC

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) April 3, 2015

But I do love that a plot twist will have y'all running back to the show like that part is equivalent to the sum. Hmm. #ScandalABC

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) April 3, 2015

Olivia Pope's bathrobe is nicer than every single thing I own.

— Margaret Lyons (@margeincharge) April 3, 2015

The narrator's first line better be something like "No one gave a shit about Ritchie and no one ever would." #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

First note: "Ritchie's dumb art." #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

This is all still about the one slap, right? #TheSlap #THESLAP

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 3, 2015

LOL #TheSlap is the shooting of Archduke Franz Ferdinand.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 3, 2015

"I thought I was doing the right thing."
"Yeah, well, so did Gavriel Princip."
That seriously just happened. #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

"This man is from the police." - an adult woman. #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

Needs more slapping. #TheSlap #THESLAP #SlappySlapmaster

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 3, 2015

They were slapping dead purgatory the whole time. I want my eight weeks back. #TheSlap #SlapwigVonSlapthoven

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 3, 2015

Follow @ NBCTheSlap for some of the most banal, content-free tweets about #TheSlap you can possibly imagine. #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

“That's what you wanted, right?” #TheSlap

— The Slap (@NBCTheSlap) April 3, 2015

I refuuuuuuuuuse to believe that Ritchie's suicide note isn't too opaque to be interpreted by a clod like GARY. #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

LOL RITCHIE'S SLOW-MOTION TRUDGE INTO THE COURTROOM #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

SAVE THE RECAPPING FOR THE PROFESSIONALS, YOUR HONOUR #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

The spinoff's going to be called "The Smug, Soft-Eyed Nod" and the only character's going to be FUCKING GARY. #TheSlap #TheSlap #TheSlap

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

#THESLAP BELIEVES THE CHILDREN ARE OUR FUTURE, YOU GUYS #THESLAP #THESLAP #THESLAP #THESLAP #THESLAP #THESLAP #THESLAP #THESLAP #THESLAP

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

That new Bible miniseries better be fucking LOADED with slaps. #TheSlap

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) April 3, 2015

@TaraAriano On the third day, Jesus slapped again.

— Joe Reid (@joereid) April 3, 2015

Sounds like I should have watched "Law & Order: Special Slapping Unit" tonight, if my feed is any indication. #TheSlap

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 3, 2015

So it turns out a wizard did it. Thanks for your patience. #THESLAP #THEEND

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) April 3, 2015

@nprmonkeysee I had money on them being on a ship to slap Mars. #THESLAP

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) April 3, 2015

BTW I like to think that Anouk and Jamie were supposed to stay together and Penn Badgley was like, "I have a thing." #TheSlap #TheSlap

By the way, this week on The Slap a character literally says "Nothing matters but the slap."

— Muffin MacGuffin🕯 (@MuffMacGuff) April 3, 2015
